title: Helping keep Ukrainians warm through the winter
description: “I worried that we wouldn’t be able to keep the house warm during the cold months.”

title: Critical livelihoods support to prevent famine
description: Of the 80 million people facing acute food insecurity in Afghanistan, about 80 per cent live in rural areas.

title: Improving aid delivery through collaboration – and extra funding
description: “Before this training, our tools were haphazardly gathered from various sources.”

title: Child protection: getting counselling, learning new skills
description: “I’m happy with what I’m learning now, I think it will help me in the future.”

title: Safe water helps families come home again
description: “It seemed as though I was spending one day at home and then a week at the hospital.”

title: Helping children living with disability
description: “We didn’t know much about his condition, and we were also struggling economically, so we weren’t able to properly attend to it.”

title: Medicines and critical supplies for overstretched clinics
description: “I was not able to visit the doctor as I had no money. But when I arrived in Kassala, my brother took me to this clinic in Halanaga and was treated for free.”

title: Pooled funds support small-scale farmers to produce food
description: Sudan | 2023 | CERF and CBPF

title: Cash helps families on the move
description: “With cash assistance, the people we are aiming to support, especially with multi-purpose cash, can get what they actually need, based on their priorities.”

title: Emergency mobile health care for expectant mothers and babies
description: “I was wondering how I can guarantee the safety of my unborn child, my other children and myself.”

title: Pooled funds provide people on the move with clean water and sanitation
description: “I want the fighting to stop, I want to play.”

title: A place to play: pooled funds support space for displaced children
description: “We have games in this place,” she says. “Every morning from 8 to 11 we come here.”

title: Pooled funds work with Palestinian and international partners to save lives
description: “We eat less so the kids can eat at least one meal a day.”

title: Cash assistance helps with the rent
description: “The situation wasn’t like this before. There were challenges, but our income was sufficient. Now, even when there’s a job, we’re still struggling.”

title: Fire safety for people in informal settlements
description: “I feel more secure. With these skills, I know I can protect my family if a fire breaks out.”

title: Keeping vulnerable children in school
description: “I truly enjoy coming to the centre… I can complete my work and feel at ease.”

title: Cash assistance helps struggling families
description: “This help was indispensable. Every person has different needs – I was able to buy the specific things I needed to grow food.”

title: Clean water supports resilience in the West Bank
description: “I was mostly concerned about the children.”

title: Access to safe water is a daily necessity – and a fundamental human right
description: “Now we have what we need to treat the water. We can use it to drink, wash, and cook. We get sick less often.”

title: Solar water station brings water to under-served communities
description: “Cleaning the house one day meant sacrificing washing clothes, or even showering.”

title: Combining WASH and GBV prevention
description: “Every year many of our kids fall sick and even die because of the water. Our animals are dying too. And we women also face harassment when we go to get water from the pond.”

title: Pooled funds bring emergency water to people affected by El Niño floods
description: “We had no place to sleep or cook as our tent was filled with water. It has been an incredibly challenging time for me and my children.”

title: Delivering assistance for women: doctor and interpreter
description: “As a translator, I help empower and support indigenous people here, especially the most vulnerable.”

title: In DR Congo, pooled funds helped families rebuild after floods
description: “I had been living a very difficult life. I lived under tarpaulins with the children and when it rained, it was tough.”

title: In South Sudan, pooled funds support psychosocial and shelter
description: “When I first arrived here, I had nothing and nobody but my children. Now I can help others.”

title: In West and Central Africa, the Regional Humanitarian Fund supports displaced women and girls
description: “Our garden used to provide us with enough food. But we lost everything.”

title: Midwifery training saves lives in remote communities
description: “We want to thank the United Nations for believing in us midwives.”

title: Braving winter and air strikes to help people in need
description: “Have you seen the prices for firewood? Where will we get the money if a truck of firewood costs UAH15,000 (US$400)?”

title: Empowering women through improved health care in Herat
description: “In just one year, this hospital has gained the trust of the community. This is because we consistently deliver quality health care.”

title: Access to information – for learning and earning
description: “Now children can study online, and adults can earn some money working online. It opens up a lot of opportunities.”

title: Providing a safe space to play in Somalia
description: “It’s not just a game; it’s like leaving all the tough stuff behind and just having fun with friends.”

title: Lifesaving cholera response in Lebanon
description: “The vaccine will ensure this illness never threatens my son’s life again.”

title: Lebanon Humanitarian Fund helps people displaced by fighting
description: “My hope is for a peaceful resolution that allows us to return to our homes with dignity, putting an end to the ongoing conflict.”

title: OCHA’s pooled funds enable lifesaving humanitarian response for people in Gaza
description: “It is terrifying. I hug and shield her with my body, fearing for her safety from breaking  glass and collapsing buildings.”

title: Pooled funds work together to deliver aid after earthquakes in Syria, Türkiye
description: “For the cost of two tents – which have to be replaced every six months – we’d like to provide a dignified shelter, providing more privacy, more durability and lasting much longer.”

title: Women and girls living in displacement can access essential supplies
description: “It helped me feel more like myself again. It’s made my life a little bit easier.”

title: Sharing knowledge to stay safe from water-borne disease
description: “This information was very useful.”

title: Making learning more comfortable
description: “I felt I’m really learning.”

title: Safe water for communities affected by conflict
description: “People got sick because of the lack of clean water. It was a hard life.”

title: Helping with the basics, when nowhere feels like home
description: “The hardest part about being displaced is fearing that you might die by going back to your hometown…”

title: Cash assistance helps Yemen’s most vulnerable families
description: Zainab wakes up every morning early to collect plastic bottles to wash and re-sell. It provides a meager addition to the other assistance she receives, but it helps.

title: A decade displaced
description: “I’m going to look after them. That’s why I’d like to work in a hospital.”

title: Responding to child abuse and gender-based violence in Nigeria
description: “The impact of this project has been significant, bringing about positive changes in the community, empowering survivors, raising awareness and creating a safety culture.”

title: Safe spaces provide a place to heal, connect, and start again
description: “What happens is that with indigenous women it is very difficult to talk about the topic.”

title: Clearing agricultural land of mines and other remnants of war
description: “Making the land safe and free of explosive remnants of the war is the first step to rebuilding resilient and prosperous rural communities in Ukraine.”

title: Emergency, ready-to-eat meals for people in the most dangerous areas
description: “It’s not possible to stay here. It’s very dangerous. But he doesn’t want to go anywhere. I don’t know what to do in this situation.”

title: Modular health-care clinics serve front-line communities
description: “While these facilities are ultimately a temporary solution, they are essential to bolstering trust in the health-care system and serving as replacements for damaged facilities for up to ten years.”

title: Helping displaced elders find community in their new home
description: “I believe that my mission is to motivate people who have just left home to keep living on, not to close in and isolate, but help them try and adapt to new realities.”

title: Domestic and gender-based violence: Raising awareness and offering support
description: “You can be completely exhausted after a long day at work. Then, late at night, you receive a call from someone asking for help.”

title: Heat and electricity for schools, hospitals and shelters
description: “Should power outages happen again, communities will be able to feel a sense of normality.”

title: The Ukraine Humanitarian Fund supports Ukrainian front line aid organizations
description: “Our priority has always been pensioners, people with disabilities, and single mothers.”

title: Providing help and resources for at-risk women and girls
description: Recent reports have revealed alarming levels of sexual and gender-based violence in Somalia, primarily targeting women, girls, and marginalized groups. In 2022, the United Nations reported 340 cases of conflict-related sexual violence, primarily attributed to clan militias and Al-Shabaab: it’s likely to be an under-count of the actual levels of risk.

title: In Somalia, CERF funding fights food insecurity
description: “For us to get clean and safe drinking water, it often meant long, arduous hours of walking to the nearest water source, which is an unsafe journey. This is a task I did not look forward to.”

title: Cash assistance to buy food and other essentials
description: “Things are good at the site – people are living in harmony. But we are just waiting for the war to finish so we can go home.”

title: Better water management makes everything come alive
description: “Being landowners, we knew we could not just sit down and do nothing. We had to keep investing in our land.”

title: Cash assistance helps displaced people start small businesses
description: The longest and most severe drought seen in Somalia in at least 40 years has affected millions and driven displacement across the country.

title: Mobile clinics provide vital support after cyclones and help people prepare for future weather events
description: “A year ago, getting health care would have been a luxury.”

title: CERF responds to food insecurity and malnutrition for very vulnerable communities
description: “This clinic is near my home, so I can easily bring Zahara.”

title: CERF SAVING LIVES: Supporting children living with disabilities in emergencies
description: “I am not like the other parents here. I have two children with disabilities.”

title: In Peru, CERF supports protection and recovery
description: “I am pleased to see that organizations like the United Nations Population Fund are fully committed to the realities we face as women every day. Through workshops and psychological and legal assistance, they provide invaluable support on our journey.”

title: In Philippines, CERF supports safe births after the typhoon
description: “During Super-typhoon Yolanda (international name: Haiyan), other provinces helped us. In return, our provincial health officer and governor wanted to give back, which was why they sent us.”

title: In Ukraine, cash assistance helps rural elders
description: “I was born during the war, far from my native country. And now, at the end of my life, I face war again, in my homeland.”

title: In DRC, pooled funding strengthens the health response to gender-based violence
description: “If we had been in our village, I would not have  suffered this, and I would not have become a mother so early.”

title: Fighting child abuse by raising the awareness of community leaders
description: “Some men take advantage of displacement, hunger and poverty to sexually assault women.

title: Changing men’s understanding and attitudes
description: “We want to engage men and boys and change their attitudes towards these practices.”

title: Supporting women in front-line response
description: “Walking together – not one behind another but side by side – we can help our region move forward.”

title: For displaced women, safe spaces help recovery
description: “These safe spaces are important.”

title: Ensuring sanitation facilities are safe for women and children
description: “Now that we have the solar lights installed, things have improved. We can see better and we feel safer.”

title: World Toilet Day: Humanitarian Fund supports improved sanitation in DRC
description: “Eleven months ago, we decided to return to our village, despite the fact that the security situation is still not entirely reassuring.”

title: El Niño 2015-2016, CERF saved lives: Emergency livelihoods and food support for people affected by drought and flooding
description: “I now sleep on a full stomach and wake with the assurance that there is still food to keep me going.”

title: El Niño 2015-2016, CERF saved lives in Somalia: Maternal health care and emergency nutrition
description: “I was so worried that I would have a miscarriage due to the effects of the drought,” said Rukiyo, adding, “We had so little to eat. I became very weak and could barely walk.”

title: Lifesaving malaria treatment reaches the unreachable
description: Adan’s recovery had major impact for others too, leading to increased community awareness about malaria prevention and creating a demand for accessible healthcare services.

title: Cash and improved technology make it easier to earn a living
description: “I started a charcoal business that is doing well. I can take care of myself without depending on my children.”

title: Shelter and household essentials in Nigeria
description: “Life has not been easy with the mosquitoes and the cold. I had to borrow a can to fetch water and had only one dish to cook and serve my family.”

title: Cash-for-work helps displaced people in Somalia
description: “Some of the beneficiaries used the money to purchase food, while others bought clothes for their children, especially last month to celebrate Eid-Al-Fitr. The money assisted a lot of us who didn’t know what to do to cover family expenses during Eid.”

title: Water for displaced people in Port Sudan
description: “We are approximately four or five refugee families from Chad. I was born in Khartoum and spent most of my life there. When the conflict erupted, we had no choice but to seek refuge here.”

title: In Nigeria, a solar-powered water well helps build a peaceful community
description: “You are welcome, my people. We are all one people. I appreciate you too.’’

title: Local organizations mobilize to help people across Sudan
description: In conflict and disaster, it is often local organizations who quickly and effectively respond to the needs of their community.  Sudan Humanitarian Fund partner HOPE Sudan is one of many such examples.

title: Emergency nutrition response requires teamwork
description: Across Sudan, more than 20 million people face acute food insecurity – meaning their inability to get adequate food puts their lives in immediate danger.

title: Mental health support for traumatized children
description: “[Another child] on his first day here …drew a military vehicle and wrote ‘Sudan is in danger.’”

title: Women’s livelihoods and changing social attitudes
description: “It helped me overcome the depression that was looming over me, and with the support I received for my business, it’s as though I have a new life,” she shared.

title: Mental health support helps long-term displaced people
description: “When I arrived here, I was traumatized by the violence I had witnessed and the losses I had suffered. I was left with nothing because I couldn’t take anything with me when I fled.”

title: Clean water is essential for patient safety
description: “Since we got [the pump], it’s been a great relief. The quality of our services has improved because we can now provide our patients with clean facilities.”

title: CERF improves rural health centers damaged by hurricanes Eta and Iota in Honduras
description: Honduras | 2023 | CERF

title: Early action to prevent a cholera outbreak in Democratic Republic of Congo
description: “When I arrived I had no water,” says Mani, at the school’s water point.

title: Anticipatory action helps households weather severe floods
description: “With the money, I’ll buy some rice and food for my family.”

title: Nutrition and health support for children
description: “If the situation is not addressed the future of Somali children is jeopardized as stunting in children is associated with an increased risk of mortality, [and] reduced cognitive development.”

title: Improving humanitarian assistance through active community engagement in Yemen
description: “These community hotlines help us be accountable and transparent, and help us adapt the program based on the real needs of affected communities.”

title: Building peace, one neighborhood at a time
description: “Before the project started, the community was indifferent, and people would not leave their homes.”

title: Keeping the children safe: moving home twice in one year
description: “I begged my husband [that we should] go anywhere, just not to stay here. There was only one thing in my head: save the children, take the children away from here.”

title: Dignified shelter brings a sense of safety to displaced families
description: “I felt such relief. There is no mud or dirt, and it did not feel cold. It feels like a home.”

title: Heating and other essentials for the cold winter
description: One of the family’s biggest challenges is preparing for the cost of surviving the winter comfortably and healthily.

title: Helping displaced children get into education
description: “I’m so happy that I’ve learned how to write and calculate. Now I can write my name and a lot of other things.”

title: Supporting long-term nutrition security for rural children
description: “I decided to lead by example.”

title: Critical water and sanitation assistance in Somalia
description: “I have a hard time putting food on the table so providing more than that is beyond what I can do.”

title: Partnership for protection: Keeping communities safe from explosive devices
description: “It’s critical that communities take ownership of risk education.”

title: Expanded education opportunities for vulnerable kids
description: “The unique teaching methods, and regular follow-up visits, along with his own school bag and stationery, have really motivated Rajab’s commitment to education.”

title: After years in a temporary shelter, a family finds a more permanent home
description: The family fled into the darkness with nothing but their lives.

title: Emergency help for families fleeing war
description: “We had to run away and leave behind everything because of fighting in our area.”

title: Enhancing accessibility: support for people with disabilities in Lebanon
description: “This makes a big difference to my independence.”

title: Cash assistance transforms Mishan’s workshop
description: “The cash helped me a lot.Without it, I wouldn’t have been able to do anything. I could barely pay my bills before, but now all I think about is buying our new home.”

title: Helping children sickened by malaria
description: “In 2022, we saw over 1,000 sick children and more than 60 per cent were suffering from malaria. Cases are recurrent and constitute the main pathology diagnosed in the region.”

title: Cash assistance helps displaced communities in Ethiopia
description: “We used to share the most basic household items with our neighbours who also had very little. We would wait for them to finish cooking and then use their pots and plates.”

title: Displaced communities get by thanks to support from local organizations in DR Congo
description: “We fled with only our clothes. When we arrived at Rusayo, we were given space for a small hut. When it rained, water leaked.”

title: Emergency care after the earthquake in Afghanistan
description: “What would have happened to us if this clinic had not been here?”

title: Safe spaces for women in Lebanon
description: “It is a heavy weight off my shoulders knowing that I am at ease with my family.”

title: Horn of Africa: Providing some relief for people displaced by drought
description: “When it became hard to get by, I left my baby at home to earn a living.”

title: Ukraine: Driving civilians out of the danger zone
description: “We had to hide and wait to be able to proceed. That day a residential building was hit, and when we went out of the basement of the school many people realized that they no longer had a place to go. Some came with us the same day.”

title: Respect, food and shelter for people affected by the Beirut blast
description: “The blast made our house uninhabitable. Everything broke – the windows, the furniture. We can’t afford to fix it up… we can barely afford to eat.” Her adult children have found their wages cut by rapid inflation.

title: Regional humanitarian fund allocates US$20 million to reach people affected by multiple crises in Burkina Faso
description: “Through the Regional Fund our partners will have the resources to help them reach a significant portion of Burkina Faso’s most vulnerable people as they deal with multiple crises.”

title: Cash assistance helps vulnerable families during the winter months
description: “There were days when we had nothing to eat but bread. The girls’ poor diet probably led to this,” said Zahira.

title: Assisting displaced people through cash transfers
description: “Four years ago, my life was beautiful. I had livestock and a farm, but then I lost everything.”

title: A safe space for women and girls affected by conflict
description: “Life is not easy,” says Ugosa “, but with the support of the social workers and other women I met here, I  have found some solace.”

title: CERF funding provides a lifeline to Yemenis during a devastating year
description: “The urgency and severity of health needs of internally displaced populations have pushed the operational capacities of our health facilities to their absolute limit…gaps in support affect the services we provide to a large extent.”

title: Village water supplies means kids can go to school
description: “I don’t want to waste my time waiting in lines for water, but it’s my responsibility.”

title: Reviving healthcare for a vulnerable community
description: Economic collapse, increased poverty and the breakdown of national social protection systems are all consequences of this drawn-out conflict.

title: Mothers in rural areas get mental and physical health care
description: Majani delivered a healthy baby boy, and mobile health services were available throughout the following weeks to check on them both.

title: Getting children back to school safely
description: “The younger children used to get frustrated and struggle in this environment. I tried to upgrade my teaching skills to provide better education and psychological support for my students, but I didn’t know where to start.”

title: Displaced families survive with emergency kits after conflict and floods
description: “The sky was full of clouds, then, suddenly, heavy rain washed away our shelters. Everything we owned – personal documents, blankets, food – it was all destroyed.”

title: Cash assistance helps families in need in Yemen
description: “Multipurpose cash assistance provides greater flexibility and choice for displaced families.”

title: Training health workers to improve children’s health
description: “Just one health worker who disseminates correct information about the vaccines and the importance of immunizing children can make a great impact and improve the services provided at their health facility.”

title: Cash assistance helps people buy what they need
description: At least 17.6 million people urgently need humanitarian assistance and protection in 2023.

title: Supporting healthcare in times of war
description: “Our goal is to help internally displaced people meet their basic needs,” explains Olga, a project manager with Première Urgence.

title: Delivering together: Pooled funds delivered medical supplies and psychosocial support
description: “We strive to provide emotional, physical, legal protection and comfort for each survivor. Our mobile teams are premised in local communities, where the need for services is the highest.”

title: Clean water on tap for displaced families
description: “In Dnipro, I used to spend UAH 15 (roughly half a dollar) per day for a large bottle of water. You may not think it’s that much money. But if you take into account all the monthly expenses, it really is,” says Yulia.

title: Healthcare relies on generators in Ukraine
description: The World Health Organization reported there had been more than 260 verified attacks on health facilities, 100 days into the war in Ukraine.

title: From student dormitory to emergency shelter
description: “I’m planning for today and maybe for tomorrow, but beyond that I don’t know. We have no plan. I just want to go back to my home and to return to our village as soon as possible when the situation allows us to travel there again.”

title: Continued help for elders in crisis
description: “The biggest worries are that with more fighting, more elderly people will be left behind, isolated and in urgent need of food, water and health and mental health support.”

title: CERF funding helps Ukrainians through a terrible year of war
description: As 2023 begins, some 17.6 million people need humanitarian assistance.

title: Cash grants help displaced people buy what they need
description: “Everyone thought this horror would end in a few days, but weeks passed, and the children started to get sick. It was cold there, and with so many people in enclosed space, the viruses spread quickly,” says Olena.

title: A respite for children in Zaporizhzhia
description: “The dog’s presence alone helps improve the children’s [mental] state.”

title: Relief for parents raising children with disabilities
description: “The money from UNICEF helped us to survive a few months,” adds Venera.

title: Livelihoods support for families affected by conflict
description: “Here, I have to cover my expenses alone. I pay the rent, the water, the wood for the kitchen, the schooling of my children,” she says.

title: Sunshine brings water to remote areas
description: “Children, youth and women commuted miles to bring drinking water to their families, and it was hard work for women and especially for children.”

title: In Burkina Faso, making clean water more accessible
description: “Before Help’s support, life was an ordeal for my children and I ­­– problems with food, water, and money. For example, to get drinking water, we had to go to the fountain 2 km away and pay 25 CFA francs per 20-litre can,” says Mrs. Dio.

title: Providing life-saving nutrition services amid armed conflict
description: “PUI staff are not able to come to our village due to the fighting, but I am still providing nutrition services, with limited resources, even in this crisis situation.”

title: Protecting the population from the threat of explosive devices
description: “This session helped me to understand what different types of explosive devices look like and the ﬁve key actions to take: stop immediately, retrace your steps, mark the ground, inform the authorities and call the 4040 hotline to report the discovery.”

title: New life after the storms
description: “We had four floods in one month, water as high as two and a half metres. It took us six weeks to clean up just to provide consultations, we had no working equipment or supplies.”

title: Local organizations reach remote communities in need
description: “Given the situation in the country, we have had to learn a new way to do our work and be present in the community, specifically around implementing humanitarian projects,” says Nhelsyr González, director of local organization Acción Campesina.

title: Helping survivors recover from gender-based violence
description: In June 2022, CERF allocated $15 million for the response to the crisis in the Central African Republic. The funding aimed to scale up emergency assistance for 200,000 with a multi-sectoral approach combining food assistance and other sectors, including protection.

title: Helping conflict affected families in Kyrgyzstan face the coldest winter in years
description: “I made a living raising sheep in my village until my house and everything we had, including the sheep burnt. We had to relocate to Bujum village and are now living in a two-room apartment of our relatives,” he said.

title: For emergency-affected women, clean delivery kits are a lifesaver
description: Even before the current emergency, Myanmar had Southeast Asia’s highest maternal mortality rate (MMR). As is the case around the world, infection and sepsis are among the leading causes of maternal deaths in Myanmar.

title: Feeding communities after the devastating earthquake in southern Haiti
description: “I would get my food every day in the morning to share with my children,” said Yolande, who moved with her family into a temporary shelter.

title: Empowering survivors of gender-based violence
description: “Thanks to the Fund’s support, we were able to reach over 9,000 people in different parts of the country.”

title: Direct cash transfers help vulnerable families
description: Solidarités International provided direct cash transfers to more than 6,000 displaced families in the Irumu territory of Ituri province in the northeast.

title: CERF strengthens health early warning systems
description: “Nearly 30 per cent of public health facilities in Syria remain non-functional,” warned Dr. Iman Shankiti, acting WHO Representative in Syria.

title: Cash support provides welcome relief after disastrous harvest
description: “The 2021 crop year was catastrophic in our region, since production was almost nil.”

title: Cash provides a lifeline for a mother and her baby
description: “I knew that with the voucher, I would be more capable of managing my family’s nutrition needs compared to receiving purely in-kind assistance.”

title: A safe space in the turmoil of crisis
description: “It is a heavy weight lifted off my shoulders knowing that I am at ease with my family,” Sana said.

title: A new start for former child soldiers
description: Because of persistent insecurity, one in five Central Africans is either internally displaced or a refugee in a neighbouring country. In October 2022, the number of newly registered displacements (29,300 people) was more than three times higher than the number of returnees (8,650).

title: Supporting GBV survivors in hard-to-reach areas
description: “The counsellor listened to me, [it] really allowed me to let off steam.”

title: Responding to food insecurity and malnutrition
description: “The child had been sick for a while, but I didn’t know what she had and worried a lot,” Jonvienne says.

title: Reclaiming Bentiu from floods
description: “Our village was submerged with water but now it has been recovered. We thought as a community the water will not disappear, but IOM stood with us that’s why the water has been pumped back to where it came from.”

title: Quake-affected clinic receives solar power
description: Natacha recalls delivering a baby in front of the hospital gate, using her phone’s light to see through the darkness.

title: Displaced women and girls assisted with dignity kits
description: “Our house was burnt to the ground and our livestock looted.  I lost everything in the blink of an eye.”

title: After devastating earthquakes CERF and AHF respond together
description: “It was 1:00 AM when we felt the earthquake. It was not a simple earthquake. We felt [like] someone was bombarding the house from the sky.”

title: Water is life: helping people face unprecedented drought
description: “Buying food was the main priority for me.”

title: Surviving devastating drought: helping communities and their animals
description: “My assets were saved – I’m selling surplus milk daily, and none of my animals died. My children were able to stay in school and continue their education.”

title: Supporting community role models for child protection
description: “Education is the most important thing in the world. It’s true that I am not working in my field, but my education has helped me a lot in my life. I can do advanced calculations to manage my small business. I can handle all of my family’s paperwork.”

title: Helping older people in the conflict zone
description: Ukraine|2020|CBPF

title: Emergency cash helps a father support his family
description: “This assistance saved the lives and livelihood of my family during this harsh and lean season and shall meet my needs for a few months.”

title: Generators ensure Ukranians’ access to healthcare
description: “The […] generators received from the United Nations will allow the operation of two hospital buildings at once.”

title: Clean water supports the wellbeing of rural communities
description: “Our children are not continually sick anymore.”

title: Supporting children injured by mines
description: “We went to sell oranges, and some of our friends went searching for scrap metal. They picked up something from the ground. The thing looked more like the usual scrap metal they sell in the market.”

title: Working with communities to contain Ebola
description: A man gets his temperature checked as part of community activities to mitigate Ebola.

title: Sharing accurate information about COVID-19 and the vaccine
description: Pakistan | 2021 | CERF

title: Reclaiming the right to education
description: “I did not think that I would finish the curriculum, especially because I had a late start, but with great encouragement from the teachers, hope has returned to me,” said Ala .

title: Rebuilding shelter destroyed by fire
description: “When this incident occurred, you brought help to us.”

title: Protection, health, and nutrition support for crisis-affected elders
description: “I like to help people—I see the conditions in which they live. They learn from me, but I learn more from them. I like to see their smile, and the shine in their eyes when they see us coming,” Malena says.

title: Local NGOs working to prevent child marriage and forced marriage
description: She made a change in her own home, persuading her husband that all their girls should go to school. Today, her three daughters attend Pibor primary school, and she hopes they will go on to complete secondary.

title: Connecting people isolated by conflict
description: “We have nothing here, nothing. We have to go to Avdiivka to get bread, salt and even matches. There is no public transport here. Nothing at all. We used to have a bus that went to Donetsk five times a day. We did not have any troubles then,” says another passenger.

title: Access to clean water
description: “I used to have to walk for hours to get water for my family,” says Nyakwoth. “For me, the journey would take even longer because sometimes I would have to carry the baby. We would have to wait for hours, [for our turn]. Sometimes, we would end up fighting over the scarce water,” she adds.

title: A helping hand during very difficult times
description: “For me, this humanitarian aid has been a support. Women are going through very difficult times in Barbacoas due to the pandemic. These grants are a helping hand for us as well as for our families,”

title: “You feel that there are actually people who care about you”
description: “The staff at the centre never failed to perform their duties, including meals and other things, even fruits were available. You feel there are actually people who care about you.”

title: Working with the community to help the most vulnerable people
description: Niger | 2021 | CBPF

title: When the borehole broke down, there was no peace: ensuring safe access to water
description: “After the borehole broke down, there was no peace among the people. They would constantly get into a quarrel at the water point.”

title: Teenaged boys reflect on child labour
description: “Saif convinced me that school is important, and I will return to complete school. I will prioritize my classes because education is like a sword that cuts off ignorance and abuse.”

title: Supporting survivors of gender-based violence
description: “Our field, our house and our livestock had gone up in smoke. ”

title: Safer homes for vulnerable families
description: “My dream was to have a home where we can be protected and live our lives with dignity,” Lina said. “We made it come true.”

title: Safe water for drought and conflict-affected people
description: “Many people left [our area] because there was no water.”

title: Responding to the fuel crisis in Lebanon
description: The fuel shortage, a result of the ongoing socioeconomic and political crises, is jeopardizing the availability of health care and drinking water for nearly everyone in Lebanon.

title: Responding to growing mental health needs
description: “I had forgotten what it feels like to be respected, and what it feels like to be a lady. You reminded me of who I used to be and who I am. You have given me the hope that I needed to keep going”.

title: Rehabilitation of damaged homes
description: “I wasn’t home when my house was hit. A neighbor called to say that it was damaged.”

title: Protecting women and girls
description: “Harassment and rape often occur when we fetch water and firewood,” she explains. “Before this training, we did not know where to seek help.”

title: Protecting the elderly in eastern Ukraine
description: “To protect from COVID-19, I had to spend a big portion of my pension on hygiene products. It is now a matter of life or death. That’s why sometimes I do not eat enough food or buy all medications I need. I simply cannot cover all of my needs.”

title: Practical help for children with special needs
description: “Now, she is communicating well with the family; she can move without struggle, comb her hair, eat alone, and play with her brothers and sisters. The exercises they taught me in the centre were very useful as I felt I could help my daughter when she was struggling,” said her mother.

title: Pooled funds work together to respond to drought-related needs
description: “Before harvesting, the cash assistance provided during the lean season was essential,” said Erasho. Afterwards, added her husband, “The [good] harvest should [allow us] to establish seed and food stocks to sustain our food security for the coming months.”

title: Pooled funds provide livelihood and nutrition help to vulnerable people in South Sudan
description: “I was able to plant twice,” she said, “and I obtained a good harvest in my first field and am hoping for the same with my second.”

title: Responding to floods in Niger
description: The Central Sahel region faces one of the world’s fastest-growing humanitarian emergencies.

title: New opportunities: Saad’s story
description: “I was able to reach my goal and provide for my family, and I will continue to develop my skills and work to build a beautiful future for my children.”

title: Mental and physical therapy in the aftermath of violence
description: “’My mental health improved after receiving the psychosocial support. I sleep better, eat better, and I’m more motivated to do my physiotherapy sessions.”

title: Legal solutions that enable people to return home
description: “I am now able to move back into my home safely and with dignity, without fear of violence as the dispute was settled peacefully and according to recognized laws.”

title: Health support for girls in forced marriage
description: “Since I was young, I’ve dreamt of becoming a doctor of obstetrics and gynecology because of the increasing number of deaths due to early marriage. When war erupted, and the conflict escalated, many families suffered, losing their jobs and becoming displaced. I moved with my family from another district near relatives in search of safety.”

title: Food and livelihoods help for vulnerable families
description: “We can even buy things we haven’t eaten [in a long time] such as legumes, halawa, and cheese.”

title: Ensuring access to COVID testing and treatment
description: “COVID-19 is real. I have been there, and it is not easy.”

title: Enabling legal solutions to return home
description: “I am now able to move back into my home safely and with dignity, without fear of violence as the dispute was settled peacefully and according to recognized laws.”

title: Emergency assistance to Afghanistan’s health infrastructure
description: “We haven’t been able to take care of them properly because we can’t afford it.”

title: Emergency assistance following the earthquake in Haiti
description: Haiti | 2021 | CERF

title: Developing an “accountability culture” among humanitarian responders
description: “The training [was] contextualized to our culture and current situation. This made it easy to understand the concepts and [apply them] to the displacement shelters where I work,” said Dawit Argawi, a Social Worker with OSSAD, a national NGO.

title: Child soldiers are reunited with their families
description: “I don’t have words to express it. I didn’t believe that I could find my child again alive one day.”

title: Ensuring dignity kits are inclusive
description: “I am so happy to see these arrangements for us. After the pandemic, we were scattered about, and we don’t have any income. I don’t even have a proper place to live at the moment, and the place where I am staying could go underwater any minute.”

title: Refuge after fleeing violence
description: “I was in the middle of teaching my class when we heard gunshots and explosions. I had to calm myself down and make sure all my students were safe.”

title: A new start through business
description: “Can you believe we saved money for three months, and now we have our own business?” asked Xamaro.

title: A new home for people  fleeing violence
description: Haiti | 2021 | CBPF

title: Health care for mothers and children who fled violence
description: “Our house was burnt down.When we fled, we lost everything. I don’t know in which direction my husband left.”
